main event: A person sighted a yellow-pink-orange light that traveled from the northeast to the southwest and disappeared in about 4 seconds over St. Louis, Missouri on February 10, 1962.
interesting points: The observer reported the object as a 'yellow-pink-orange light' that moved at a high speed.
The object was observed for a brief duration of 4 seconds.
The object's course was unknown according to the report.
No photographs were taken of the sighting.
The conclusion in the report was 'ASTR (METEOR)'
